member.name: T:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Cti.Providers.CallClassProvider
member.summary: This represents a single active call. A call within the local phone system will be represented by a call object on each of the line objects that are in the call.

member.summary: Creates an instance of the provider based on the configuration data.
member.returns: The actualized Call object

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Cti.Providers.CallClassProvider.TransferInit(System.String)
member.summary: First half of two-step (warm) transfer. First call is on hold and new call is made.
member.returns: Negative for an error

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Cti.Providers.CallClassProvider.TransferComplete
member.summary: First half of two-step (warm) transfer. First call is on hold and new call is made.
member.returns: Negative for an error

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Cti.Providers.CallClassProvider.TransferCancel
member.summary: Cancels a two step transfer that has completed the first step but not the second.
member.returns: negative for error

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Cti.Providers.CallClassProvider.Conference(Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Cti.Providers.CallClassProvider)
member.summary: Setup an conference with the call.
member.param: The actualized call with which to conference.
member.returns: negative for error

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Cti.Providers.CallClassProvider.ConferenceInit(System.String)
member.summary: First half of a two step conference call. Puts original call on hold and makes second call.
member.returns: negative for failure

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Cti.Providers.CallClassProvider.ConferenceComplete
member.summary: Second half of a two step conference call. Joins the two calls together.
member.returns: negative for failure

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Cti.Providers.CallClassProvider.ConferenceCancel
member.summary: Cancels a two step conference call that is thru the first step but not joined yet.
member.returns: negative for failure

member.name: T:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Cti.Providers.TelephonyProvider.CtiType
member.summary: The following is so each line can specify what type of CTI is used with it. Initially all the lines will have the same type, but in the future, some lines may be TAPI while others might be TSAPI or RTC.
member.remarks: With the provider pattern added to the telephony system, the type is no longer decided through this enum and the parameters, but through configuration. For backward compatibility it has been left in.
